revised_title: Investigating the Heat of the Moon and Stars using the Radio-Micrometer
tldr: The author develops a new method using the radio-micrometer to measure the heat of celestial bodies, such as the Moon and stars, with greater sensitivity and accuracy than previous methods. The radio-micrometer offers advantages over thermopiles and galvanometers, as it is less affected by magnetism and external temperature changes, and provides faster measurements.
